text.section: Any person who interferes with or attempts to prevent the Commissioner of Agriculture from exercising any of his powers under KRS 249.183 to 249.195 shall be punished by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) or by imprisonment for not more than six (6) months.

Any person who violates any regulation prescribed by the Commissioner under KRS 249.183 to 249.195 shall be fined not less than fifty dollars ($50) nor more than two hundred dollars ($200). Each day of violation after the notice provided in KRS 249.190 shall be a separate offense.

law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 433, sec. 5, effective April 10, 1990. -- Created 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 11, sec. 9.
